38918505.review:
A REALLY great hidden gem of a game. The Walking Vegetables is genuinely fun, addictive and funny. There is SO much content in this supposedly little game. There are tons of enemy types with their own attack variations, animations and looks, there are many unique bosses (I've only defeated 2 so far) and tons of unlockables - be it guns, throwables or melee weapons. Everything in this game is original. The music is great too as is the art style.

If you're thinking about picking this one up, do it - you won't regret it.

This is an ACTUALLY FUN game, something I've not come across in a while.

38564994.review:
I initially saw this game in a letter from YoYo Games. I felt interested in this game so I check it out. After many hours of playing, I think it's time to write a review.

[b]+Easy game control.[/b]
The control is simple. Just use the mouse buttons with a few keyboard keys, like many other shooting games.
[b]+Cool graphic.[/b]
I love the pixel art style.  :D  Really COOL. I'm speechless.
[b]+Lots of features.[/b]
Many kinds of enemies, weapons and skills. Although there's no checkpoint or mid-way save, your skills will make your gameplay easier.
[b]+Awesome soundtrack.[/b]
The music is really awesome! (it reminds me of Metal Slug) Besides, it changes with your health and the kinds of enemies you are facing.

[b]-The content is limited.[/b]
There are only three levels. I completed the game within a day. I think it need more updates and personally I want a skill upgrade system to encourage me to get more achievements.
[b]-Bugs appear at times.[/b]
Sometimes, enemies such as oranges and apples, will not disappear after I killed them. They still walking but won't hurt me. The building cannot be cleared so I have to restart.

[b]Overall   7/10[/b]
I love this game. It's a really nice and awesome shooting game, [strike]although it seems a bit expensive.[/strike] However, [b]I believe that there are lots of things we can do to improve it and make it more enjoyable. And I do believe that the developers can make it better :D[/b]  So I recommend it.

38227761.review: I got this from the developer on twitter and decided to check it out. Great game about fighting hordes of vegetables and fruits in a city. I had a blast and enjoy the cool pixel art style which makes it even more fun. Loads of things to do and lots of weapons to choose from. Love playing this game overall. Its probably even better with 2 people playing. Would've totally been worth buying if i didn't get this free. Thanks for making this cool indie game!

37802677.review:
[h1][b]          Cômico e muito divertido[/b][/h1]

[b]          The Walking Vegetables[/b] é claramente uma sátira de [b]Hotline Miami[/b], porém com suas originalidades. No game controlamos um exterminador de vegetais, há diversos inimigos e muitos locais jogáveis, os cenários são bem diversificados e o mais divertido é que em cada jogada a experiência será diferente, já que os inimigos e itens que encontramos são aleatórios, assim como chefes.

          Uma das coisas mais bacanas é que o jogador pode [b]desbloquear habilidades para o personagem conforme vai desbloqueando as conquistas[/b], algo muito raro de se ver, sendo desde um bônus de dano até uma vida extra. O arsenal do jogo é bastante extenso, há muitas armas, tanto brancas quanto de fogo, também há uma grande variedade de itens secundários, tudo pode ser [b]encontrado durante o gameplay ou comprado[/b] com [b]dinheiro do jogo[/b] em uma loja disponível nas cidades de cada nível.

          Um dos, e [b]talvez o único ponto negativo do game[/b], é que ele não possui salvamento de níveis, é preciso fazer tudo em apenas uma jogada, se o jogo for fechado, ao abrir novamente será necessário começar do zero, apenas as habilidades desbloqueadas com conquistas são salvas.

[b]          The Walking Vegetables[/b] possui uma ótima trilha sonora e um estilo gráfico retrô bem bacana. A jogabilidade é simples e direta, tudo funciona muito bem, além do mais, há compatibilidade total à controle.

          Apesar de ser um game simples em 2D, muito conteúdo e diversão é o que não falta no jogo, além de contar com conquistas desafiadoras e um gameplay viciante.

[*][h1][b]Pontos positivos:[/b][/h1]
[*]Muito divertido
[*]Desafiador
[*]Bastante conteúdo
[*]Recompensas ao alcançar cada conquista
[*]Preço acessível

[*][h1][b]Pontos negativos:[/b][/h1]
[*]Sem localização PT-BR
[*]Não tem save de níveis

[quote][i]Análise escrita para o curador [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/cacadoresdeconquistas#curation]Caçadores de Conquistas[/url].[/i][/quote]

37278829.review:
광기 서린 야채들의 역습.

미쳐 날뛰는 야채들을 쏴제끼는 트윈스틱 슈팅 게임이다. 다양한 무기의 존재와 총알의 제한, 스킬 해금, 무기 해금등을 통한 반복플레이 유도, 방을 이동하며 열쇠를 얻고 보스를 상대하는 게임플레이 등은 확실히 엔터 더 건전과 유사하다. 그래도 건전에 비해 적들도 더욱 많이 몰려오고 게임의 템포도 빠르다는 점은 높게 평가할 수 있을 것 같다. 다만 쌈마이가 충만해 보이는 분위기에 비해 유머나 패러디 같은 양념이 부족해 보기보다 게임이 좀 심심하게 느껴질 여지는 있다.

준비된 스테이지가 고작 3개 뿐이라 한 번 게임을 클리어하는데 걸리는 시간은 20분에서 30분 정도로 짧은 편이다. 또한 강력한 무기들을 어느 정도 해금하고 게임에 어느 정도 익숙해지면 난이도도 그리 어렵진 않다. 다만 게임 자체가 짧은 걸 다양한 해금 조건을 지닌 스킬들을 통한 반복 플레이 유도로 어느 정도 해결한 모습이다. 몇 가지 귀찮거나 난해한 해금 조건을 지닌 스킬들이 존재하긴 하지만, 시간을 투자해 스킬 해금하는 재미 역시 쏠쏠하다. 

비록 아류는 원작을 뛰어넘을 순 없지만 아류에게도 아류 나름의 매력이 존재함을 보여준 게임.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/221147929957

36281154.review:
This game is what you get when you combine The Binding of Isaac + Geometry Wars and add a dash of Plants vs. Zombies, only now the plants are the bad guys.  If you compare this to when BoI came out and the original version of GW; it's at least as good as either of those were and it's an addictive combination of both.  

Semi-random notes:
- I didn't use to hate tomatoes or oranges, but now I do.  
- I once fought a fire extinguisher and it won.  
- Orange slices are mean little b4stards.  

Some of you will find this game to be too easy.  I hate you all.  Casuals like me cry during games like this, nerd rage the controller into pieces, and then do it all over again.  It's an easy thumbs up!

It looks like the author has been making some updates too, so that's commendable.  I hope they consider the following changes:
- More difficulty levels (but leave the default difficulty the way it is) with associated achievements
- Customizable controls for the controller
- A cheat menu to let me choose my randomizer seed.  Maybe this should come without achievements, but personally I would like to explore the game's different modes.  For example:  One does not always get to fight the fire extinguishers.  They normally just blow up.  WTH?  Cool idea anyway.

36025480.review:
Got it for free for a week. The Short Beta Key from Bundlestars (as of Nov.1 named Fanatical) I enjoyed very much. 

I didnt beat the game despite wielding the Giant almost every playtrough and blasting everything with one shot weapons... but I see its potential. Of all the twin stick coop shooters I played this has one of the best gameplay feelings to it. Repetitiveness is also not a big deal since you yourself can chose how fast you go from chapter to chapter. 

There are lots of weapons which you can all collect and select on a weapon wheel while the time slows down around you THere is also a melee component which is a must to get rid of incoming enemies and some projectiles. Furthermore you got your trusty randomization, respawning enemy waves, shops and crate drops after clearing out houses. It is also kid friendly since most of the time you will be slaughtering bizarre looking vegetables - which you can still hit with you melee weapon for a short time after you already killed them. So satisfying!

The music is just great. Depending on how much action is going on there are heavy metal tunes kicking in and fading out after the onslaught. Like bread and butter coming together for an epic breakfast meal.

There is an exploding Angel or Ghost... (he prefers the name Bob) who gives you the chance to get one of your items from a previous run. Its a roulette wheel that you can stop yourself so it does not give a feeling of complete random ripoff, but I only saw him once. 

Either way. I didn't beat the game but I highly recommend it and put it on wishlist and follow.

35998883.review: I was thinking this game is a beta version, and that is because it seems like that.

35978668.review: It just isn't that interesting.  The only thing it really has going for it is the weapons, and that's not enough to carry a game.

35976100.review:
The Walking Vegetables is a 16-bit rogue-like/action game, where your main objective is to explore, fight, take loots, survive and discover new areas. 

It seems that at 1980’s, an evil alien race has invaded Earth, turning all vegetables into crawling, bawling, mauling abominations. You are about to join Department Radical, the grooviest police force on Earth to clean all this mess and return the peace to the streets. 

You have to play several chapters divided in areas where an army of vegetables (carrots, potatoes, onions an so on...) are going to try to kill you. There are multiple buildings filled with enemies too, where you can fought through for a loot or for a some keys to unlock chests and some other buildings. There are a shop too to improve you weapons or buy medical kits and at the end of each area you are going to beat a boss.

The guy is easy to control using four arrows to move and mouse to aim and shoot. You can use several weapons (two of which are active and the rest selectable via a mouse wheel), a melee weapon and a a rechargable item that you can unlock. There are awide range of weapons and it's a good point that you can press the mouse button to shoot continuosly instead of destroying it, clicking thousands of times on it.

Tha main character and all the vegetables are well defined but, in general, graphics are very pixelized trying to emulate the games of 80's 

Music sounds well at the first ten minutes but then it turns a little bit annoying. Sounds are quite good too and the sound of weapons are nice.

The game is not very difficult but scenarios are wide and there is not checkpoints so, five bars of life sometimes are very few to complete the chapter.

The game has achievements but it has not trading cards. I encourage to developers to add them in next releases. 

Sometimes when you  play a game, you find something different, sometimes, you find a gem and sometimes you find a game you had played before. This game is in this last group of games, so if you like the games like  The The Binding of Isaacc, play it. In other case eat some carrots. That's all folks!!

PS: Thanks to Shade00

35946508.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yI69Gq1XlMQ
[quote=W jednym zdaniu] [h1]Bardzo śmieszkowa i lekko oryginalna klimatycznie nawalanka w stylu rogalowym [/h1]  [/quote]
[b]Więcej - http://broda.tv/ [/b]

Z jednej strony niewielka ilość ocen dla tej produkcji nie jest jakoś specjalnie dziwna - dziesięć euro za coś, co na pierwszy rzut oka nie zachęca. Ja postanowiłem tu zostawić lajkacza z trzech powodów. Po pierwsze, klimat tej gry - walczymy z warzywniakami, świeżakami, cytrynami, arbuzami i innymi tego typu sprawami. Każdy z nich ma swój "typowy" styl atakowania nas - na przykład groszek rozsypuje się na małe gówniaki, a cebula zaczyna płakać powodując mylącą kierunki substancję. Druga sprawa to dynamika rozpierduchy - ten rogal jest szybki i przyjemny. Po trzecie - nie przesadnie duża cena, 10 ojro za taki tytuł to cena dla mnie odpowiednia. Jest trochę wad - czasami kamera źle pracuje, czasami dostaniemy przez ścianę, gra mogłaby być też nieco dłuższa.

35934706.review:
I've played this game over the free beta weekend and completed 'part 1' so far.
It's enjoyable enough, just not quite as hardcore as 'Nuclear Throne' or 'Enter the Gungeon'.
Not sure if you can save your progress, so I had to let it sit idle for an hour or so while I was away.

Pros:
Controls felt nice (I used a Xbox360 Controller).
Nice selection of weapons, you can feel like a badass.
Length of 'part 1' seemed about right, but...

Cons:
No save feature could become a drag if you need to complete 'parts' in one sitting (I assume you can continue from after a completed 'part'?), especially if you died and hard to start again.
Game had some random lag every now and again for no apparent reason.

If you enjoy twin-stick shooters then I recommend you give it a try. It's more a casual pick-up-and-play when you have 15 minutes to kill than something you might sink more time into like 'Nuclear Throne' or 'Enter the Gungeon'. This could be a good starting point for someone entering the twin-stick shooting genre.

[h1]Edit;[/h1]
Just a warning that I don't think it has any save functionality. If you die in 'part 2' then you have to go back to the beginning of 'part 1' and start all over again. So, it has perma-death and you need to complete the entire game in one sitting?

35926960.review: I played this over the free weekend and it was alright. Maybe worth $5, not $10. It's still better than Nuclear Throne because they at least give your pistol autofire instead of making you click for each bullet fired. Weapons are sometimes pretty rare for a while until you find them so you are stuck using the pistol for a large part of the first level. You have to turn off some god awful "vhs effect" that makes the game look like it has horrific screan tearing. You also will want to turn off the screen shake unless you want a neverending headache. It's decent fun if you can get it on sale, very nice artwork and graphics, and the gameplay and controls are solid.

I played this is a time limited key.  
I had no expectations of this game but I wasn't that impressed.  I found the maps annoying as only one building in unlocked at a time forcing you to trapse around the map to get the the unlocked building whilst avoiding the spawning vegetables monsters that home in on you, but have very little game value other than to soak up your hard earned limited ammo as they mass rush you, the unlimited ammo gun is next to useless against them.  

My play time is very short, but I've seen enough of the game mehcanics that I'm unlikely to play anymore. I'm not a fan of the graphics or presentation and I prefer to play Neclear Thrones for my button mashing fun.

Я обязательно подумаю о покупке этой игры.
Очень стильный и сочный визуальный ряд (даже эффект полосок на экране (хотя они у меня и без этой игры были)), неплохая стрельба, много оружия и много врагов.
Также можете подключить любой геймпад и звать друга играть. (Если верить указанному "Общий/Разделенный экран")

Сам геймплей состоит из зачисток зон, после которых на локации можно найти сундуки, переход по улицам к другим зонам, открытие нового оружие, собирание монеток.
Так что 7/10 плачущих луковиц, которых тебе жалко убивать.(ха-ха, вы поверили?)

A good top-down shooter.
I've only used three other weapons than the basic pistol, but I can se how it will keep getting better!
I love the music and how it changes when you take more and more damage.
The random generation of the buildings and enemy spawning keeps you on your toes and at no point does this game take itself seriously. It's an instant classic to lovers of the genre!

So far, I'm enjoying playing through co-op with a friend but sadly I only have the free beta weekend (Might have to change that though...)
The game is quite hard, but the more you play, the more you get and the better you get! Put some real rubber to the road and you'll get further each time!

Letuice just say that I grape when enemies span on top of me... peas fix the bugs and don't leaf them in there. I'll have to play more tomato and hopefully carrot get further this time!

[b]
اعتقد مطور اللعبه "دب" او حاقد ع النباتيين 
اللعبه كفكره وكموسيقى حلوة رغم انو تحس الموسيقى اسرع من حركة الشخصيه نفسها 
اللعبه فيها نفس نظام الصعوبه الي بدو يرجعون له تموت تخسر كل شي وتعيد من البدايه 
كذلك فيها صعوبه من ناحيه استخدامك للقطع النقديه عشان تشتري اما شنطه اسعافات او اسلحه او ذخيره 
 ففي كل مره تشتري حتكون نفس الاداه اعلى سعراً في المرات القادمه وهالشي حلو يخليك تجمع كثير وماتشتري الا الاشيا الي محتاجها 
وبرضو فيها تحديات بحيث مع اكمالك للتحدي تفتح ميزه لشخصيتك اما قلب اضافي للقلوب الاساسيه او حمل سلاحين وغيره 
الجرافكس ممتع للعين وهو ع نهج كم لعبه سابقه في فكرة الابتعاد عن المربعات الميته الي تلاقي شخصيه لكن مافي حولها الوان وحياه 
وبعيد عن مبالغه بعض المطورين الصغار الي يحاول انو يوصل لجرافكس حلو وفي الاخير النتيجه غير مرضيه هذا في المنتصف 
وطبعا مع كل ليفل او كما يسمى باللعبه بارت حيتكررو الاعداء لكن حيظهر لك كم عدو جديد يغير اسلوب لعبك 
فمثال انت  لديك مضرب وسلاح عادي المضرب ضرره ضعيف مقارنه بالسلاح خاصه انك تحتاج تستخدمه عن قرب
لكن الحلو لو كان خصمك عنده القدره ع اطلاق النيران او السم او اي شيء تستطيع رد الضربه اما عليه او على من حوله ومو محتاجه فن 
كلها صدف , في النهايه الي يحب دوخه الراس وموضوع الروح الواحده ان كسبت فأنت تحديت نفسك ومن هالحكي حتعجبه اللعبه 
[/b]

35855955.review:
The Walking Vegetables is an interesting little game. I honestly nearly wrote it off when I first checked it out, but I'm really glad I gave it a shot; it's a fast paced and fun rogue-lite shooter with a rather unique theme.

Something I really loved about the game is how the theme is used to create some very visually distinct enemies. Every enemy type is a different vegetable which allows, at a glance, to know not only what I'm facing but allows me to figure out what to expect. Lemons? They will leave pools of harmful lemon juice. Broccoli, on the other hand, will charge at me; while leeks will try to ambush and so on. With the game's more fast paced combat, having that instant recognition of the different enemy types is a definite plus.

Another thing about the combat I really liked is that it didn't feel as reliant on the rolls of the dice as other games in the genre. When I lost it always felt like it was due to a lack of skill on my part and not having enough power though my guns and pick ups. I always had options to overcome bad luck by simply killing more of the horde for money or hitting optional buildings for more rolls of the loot dice and objects to destroy for chances of drops. I never felt like I was out of options and I was under-powered, just lacking in the skill to make it further.

That's not to say there's aren't things I dislike about the game. One thing I didn't care for was sheer lack of info the game provides. Now, I realize that figuring things out on your own is, for the most part, a staple of the genre. However, hiding gameplay mechanics seems a bit much to me and a lack of tutorial does just this. Perhaps the greatest example of this is in melee and that melee weapons can be used to knock back bullets to kill enemies. The only place the game made mention of this, when I spent time in the game, is in the tool tip of an unlockable skill as its requirement. This seems like a pretty key game play element that is hidden and does make wonder if I am missing other important things. 

Speaking of skills. The other thing I didn't like is how slow it is to unlock things in the game. While I don't want all the skills handed to me, but some of them are a rather long grind to unlock, even ones that you would naturally unlock by playing the game. Destroying 3,000 objects, for example, to unlock a single skill. Weapons also seem to unlock rather slowly, requiring a currency, called rad rocks, to unlock new drops via the in game store. While the dev did drop by my video to say that there's ways to get them that I didn't find yet, at least at the start of the game, until you find what the dev was hinting that, it's a bit of a slog to get new guns in the drop pool.

Overall, I really enjoyed my time with The Walking Vegetables. It's a silly concept that has been developed well into a fast paced, unique rogue-lite. To top it all off, the game is getting a lot of post-launch support with new enemies, modes, and of course bug fixes. While the game may not be as deep as others in the genre, it has a lot of style and fun that makes it well worth a look. 

Version Played: Post-Launch Patch 1, 10/02/17
 [url=https://youtu.be/ziTKDSLbhRk] My full first impressions video [/url]

35778024.review:
Everything right about indiegame dev. 

The Walking Vegetables is made by the insanely talented dev behind Zombie Kill of the Week. That game is a cult classic masterpiece for relaxing zombie slaughtering and fun multiplayer zombie slaughtering. When the Walking Vegetables was announced I didn't know what to make of it, but I bought it anyway. I was treated to a really interesting and hard rogue-lite game that infuriated me but for some reason kept bringing me back. I didn't love it, but I couldn't stop playing it. 

In the short time, the game has been released the developer has been reacting to player feedback with bug fixes, tweaks, and updates. This sort of responsive understanding and talented game dev is doing everything right. I wholeheartedly recommend this game. It was worth the asking price at launch and it's an even better game now. 

It's not perfect, it can be frustrating and a bit cheap at times. But it's fun. Damn fun. It's fun to play alone. It's fun to watch someone play and it's fun to play with your friends. BUY THIS!

35777024.review:
The Walking Vegetables feels familiar, with its gameplay reminding me of The Binding of Isaac & Nuclear Throne with a bit of Hotline Miami's fast gameplay style.

The Walking Vegetables has very eye catching graphics, at least for the first part of the game. I found that Part 2 of the first campaign had too many "solid" and repetetive colors, that the first part didn't. But, in general, the game's graphics are put together well. Playing this game on a laptop with a rather bad display was not as enjoyable as playing on a better quality screen with more vibrant colors. 

The game relies heavily on randomness, much like The Binding of Isaac, but in The Walking Vegetables, almost everything feels random, which adds a lot of replayablity, but I dislike the fact that it relies on randomness so much. Some playthroughs can be easier, or harder, just based on what enemies spawn on which playthrough. Health can only be replenished with a health crate, or a health drop from an enemy. But these drops are always random, 1 heart, 2 heart, etc. The game's difficulty is rather well balanced though, despite the randomness.  

The music for The Walking Vegetables is good, and I really liked how depending on how low your health is, the faster the music plays, which add's a feel of adrenaline.

Since the game came out, the developer has pushed out multiple content updates, and by the looks of how often his previous game got updated after its Steam release, this game is going to keep on receiving content updates for a while.

If you're a fan of previously mentioned games, I would recommend this game to you.

35522994.review: Really fun Indie style top down shooter! Power ups, guns, and vegetables need I say more? Fun local co-op also. A fun quick relaxing game to slay some veggies and try to get some more loot, I've really enjoyed it so far.

35506490.review:
This game's nice. Maybe not GOTY, but most things work well enough.

The structure is simple enough - to beat the campaign (which is something you'll do multiple times), you have to get past several "chapters", each concluding with a boss fight. Areas consists of a large "hub" (which has paths to other areas and constantly spawning enemies), multiple "objective areas" (where you fight a number of enemies to unlock the path to the boss), multiple buildings (which are also filled with enemies and can be fought through for loot) and a shop.
The player can carry multiple ranged weapons (two of which are active and the rest selectable via a wheel-menu), a melee weapon, and a rechargable item (effects from use vary).
Choices of enemies/bosses per area, building layouts, item drops, etc. are randomized, which has it that you encounter familiar hand-crafted elements but in different pattern on each session.
A single session can take between 20 to 60 minutes depending on how many optional paths you decide to take - sticking with a few weapons and taking only required paths generally has you looking to finish one session in 30 minutes or less. Par for "speedrun" unlock is 15 minutes (which I was able to beat with 12m after several attempts).
Performing specific objectives unlocks "skills", which stick between sessions and influence one or other aspect of the game (e.g. increasing health, making some attacks more powerful, or changing equipment the player starts with). You can pick several of these to be used for a session (eventually up to 4 at once). Other things that persists between sessions is "meta-currency" awarded for beating bosses (which is used to unlock new weapons/items).

I'd say that the game is well-rounded in terms of difficulty - enemies come in multiple shapes and forms, but so do weapons, and the fact that you can find and carry multiple of them at once allows to prepare for most situations. Bosses are manageable, switching between several patterns. Achievements mimic in-game skill unlocks and should be managable enough with some practice and strategy (many unlock conditions are much easier met with specific equipment/skill combinations).

Artwork is distinguishable enough and generally stylish. The game makes use of several visual effects by default, which can be disabled in settings menu.

Audio is fine. Using some of the melee weapons (such as "shivs" and throwing stars) too quickly allows to reach the point where sounds of preceding attacks start to cut out before finishing.

Music is remarkably catchy and fitting.

I was able to unlock all skills/achievements in ~12 hours (counting a few offline), though I'm yet to unlock a number of weapons.

Subjects of consideration:
- "tongue of steel" skill (which prevents player from taking damage when walking over pools of fire/acid) is more or less a requirement with a number of bosses, as arenas can be small and dancing between boss, enemies, and hazards can be a trouble.
- Either by design or not, but the fact that melee weapons deflect all projectiles in front of the player and have generally high attack rate has it that you may very well just swing them constantly. Multiple other games in the genre share this mechanic and it is only a little unfortunate when the game's balance is built around this. Too late to change anyway.
- With keyboard controls, when moving straight into an obstacle, the character seems to simply pick clockwise direction. This makes for a bit of inconvenience in first few hours of play, as the usual behaviour in such cases is to have the character move towards the nearest corner (i.e. pick direction that has a shorter walk distance until movement in original direction can be resumed) if at all in such situation.

Overall, it's worthwhile.

35426208.review: A very hard but fair difficulty, co-op mode was fun, some of the guns were unbalanced (Minigun comes to mind) the campaign was speedrun-friendly, but maybe some more mandatory objectives or stuff to do. Great game! Worth every dollar!

35420771.review:
Good top-down shooter, and quite hard as a roguelike should be.

Weapon balance works well. There are several ammo types and weapons use ammo at different rates; some can be used forever while some very powerful ones eat ammo supplies in seconds. The game encourages switching weapons often to match the situation and to conserve ammo. There is enough ammo loot to use some decent weapon all the time.

The 80s theme is strong in visuals and music, while each type of vegetable has some personality.

Most of the game is in outdoor areas, but there are also buildings and bonus levels. It's a good change of pace from dungeons of games such as Binding of Isaac.

35252587.review: 冲着《Zombie Kill of the Week》同样作者才买的。拿到新武器后打起来很爽快，近战武器也能弹开怪物的子弹。粉水晶可以解锁东西。好像不能存档，除了解锁的东西每次武器都要从新刷。默认屏闪晃的眼睛要命，经开发者提醒可以在选项里关掉抖动和屏闪，这个很重要。开发者很用心，目前游戏还在更新。

35248738.review:
XBOX Oneコントローラーを使用。

[u]地球を侵略しにやってきたエイリアン達によって巨大化し狂暴になってしまった野菜や果物をあの手この手を使いぶっ倒していく見下ろし型視点のローグライトアクションシューター。[/u]

ローグライクな要素としては死亡すると最初のステージからプレイしなおしなこと、お金と鍵を失ってしまう事だ。

[h1][b]良い点[/b][/h1]

・ゲームプレイは基本的に銃を撃ちまくる爽快な物になっている。サブウェポンで近接武器（基本的には）を使用することもできる。初期から所持している銃は弾が無限に撃てるがその他のマシンガン等は弾薬を入手する必要がある。ただ、銃弾は豊富に入手できるので、少なくとも序盤で困ることは少ない。

・ステージ中武器はランダムで入手するが、どれも有用な物ばかりで、どの武器が出現しても困る事は無い。好きな武器が欲しいときはステージ中のショップで買うこともできる。

・ボス戦は打って変わって緊張感の高いものになっている。気を抜くとあっさりと倒されてしまうので注意。ボス戦時は雑魚敵も出現するので彼等から弾薬を入手することが可能になっている。

・実績のようなシステムがあり、それらの特定の条件を満たすことでスキルが解除される。例えば「HPが最大の時にヘルスボックスを20回開けろ」の様な物がある。簡単なものだと特定のボスを倒せというものも。スキルはボスを弱体化させる物から主人公を強化するものまでいろいろとあり、どれも有用だ。

[h1][b]悪い点[/b][/h1]

・特にチュートリアルがなく、初回プレイ時には少し戸惑う。

[h1][b]総評[/b][/h1]

程よい難易度の出来の良いシューターになっている。このタイプのゲームが好きなのであればオススメだ。是非とも苦手な野菜とそうでない野菜共もまとめて血祭りにあげてやろう。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/9Wz3hZi0R2I]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。
